page.title: 12FLORA
page.content: In the boggy areas the bog myrtle (myrica gale) grows,and certain parts have a magnificent display of bog asphodel (narthecium ossifragum). The common sundew (drosera rotundifolia) and cotton grass (eriophorum angustifolium )are found in these wet areas after with sphagnum moss. In previous years I have seen marsh gentian(gentiana prenmonanthe) in this area, but it is not flowering at this present time. ii) The second area (the Dark Water valley) is more fertile and less acid, containing broad leaved woodland and lusher vegatation in general. Some of the heathland plants (eg. tormentil, heath bedstraw) grow here also, but foxgloves, brambles and bluebells are common along the roadsides at different times of the spring and summer.
